author: Braden
title: Animal Conservation - NFT Rewards
description: Animals in Africa and other countries are being killed to extinction by poachers, climate change and deforestation.

assessments.note: I give a 2 for impact because it is an interesting idea I just don't know how much value Cardano users will get by 1 degree removal from the stake pool. I like the idea of helping animals, but I don't think it really addresses the DApp challenge. It is also unclear whether the proposers can scale this project because their proposal states that they don't know how the API or oracles even work.
This seems like it could be a good idea, though the technical details seem to still need to be worked out.

This Challenge is very focused on attracting new users to the platform. I feel like the majority of participants in the project will already be staking their ADA. However, it may onboard users into the NFT world, and may attract ADA holders in exchanges to delegate directly. Protectors and Ambassadors may also be onboarded into the Cardano ecosystem.  The concept meshes well with the Africa and mission driven stake pools them. I think the impact of the project is potentially large.

This is a very good proposal and is one of the things that we must start to value: Nature and wildlife.
Having a place that helps you to donate, having a return (NFT or some part of the pool) is a incredible thing to whom thinks about the future of the planet.
I also think that this idea can aggregate people almost immediately, since who is involved with this kind of things will not lose time.

There is a large number of people who are ready to contribute to Wildlife preservation. A dApp based assured impact project is likely to attract volunteer staking and donors. Moreover, the proposal will also provide a staking reward redistributable system which is likely to find more than one use case.

The proposer outlines how trending incentives (e.g. NFTs) can be combined with social/environmental causes while proposing novel incentives like animal encounters that could be possibly be implemented in the future. If this type of reward is viable is yet to be seen but the idea is certainly refreshing and likely very impactful to supporters. This DApp would bring increased utility to Cardano and would drive adoption. While the link to the Africa challenge is there (the proposer says so himself), animal conservation is also an interest in developed nations and has global utility. The TL;DR is on this page, for more in-depth details, make sure to refer to the pdf.
I do not think that this is feasible because the proposers state at several points throughout the text that they aren't sure how things work or what their plan really is.

The proposer doesn't seem to have the techincal skills to build the DApp. Thus it is hard to state it will be successfully delivered as the technical path has not been laid out. It would be good to inlude recrd keeping of donation amounts (and recording ADA value in FIAT on the date of donation) to allow for tax reporting in countries where donations are tax deductible. This may also required choice of registered entities by reporting countries for eligibility.

The proposer presented a clear budget and roadmap. The only thing that might aggregate the project is specifically say how much the ambassador will need, for example. It's hard for me to depend on a person in a dapp to give me critical information, since the proposal says nothing about contracts and payments.
The proposal is detailed and the proposal has substantial experience. The plan is comprehensive and has a detailed analysis of steps and the process to be undertaken each step.

The plan is thorough. Where the proposer is not sure about an implementation detail, an educated assumption has been made that appears feasible.

The proposer was quick to send his cv on request and underlines the listed development experience. The Greebly Monster NFTS (listed in the attached pdf) are not insignificant in establishing trust.

My suggestion to the proposer is to start reaching out to protectors soon and get some buy-in from them.
I give a 1 for auditability because the timeline is vague and metrics unclear. Some of the metrics the proposer says they aren't sure if they can track it.

Currently this is in the form of an idea with a few potential options for being technically delivered. What it need sis a technical roadmap on what will actually be built with milestones to allow progress to be monitored and success likelihood assesed.
Since we are depending in some people to do the job of validating some institution, we must have some warranties of these people.

The goals and process is laid out clearly the proposal is complex and involves building more than 10 smart contracts and a integrated platform. However, it will be easy to monitor and audit the progress as per the plan presented.
The breakdown of the requested funds (see pdf), the listed metrics, open-sourcing the contract, and the communication with the proposer warrant the highest auditability score.

solution: Develop a Staking Rewards Distribution System via a Smart Contract to support these Organizations and the Supporters with NFTs
experience: I have over 30 years of experience as a software developer and entrepreneur in New Zealand and The UK.
